page.title: 01Description of The Shelsleys
page.content: This is an area of great natural beauty;steep hills on each side of the {River Teme}which flows from north to south. Cottages and larger houses are dotted among the hills,each one with its own beautiful view, to Clee Hill in the north and Malvern Hills in the south. These houses are reached by steep narrow lanes, frequently blocked by snow in winter. Perhaps because of this traditional isolation, the "Valley" feels itself cut off, and does not really mix with the inhabitants of nearby Great Witley, Clifton-on-Teme, or Martley. Life is peaceful in The Shelsleys apart from the three Hill Climb fixtures a year. Only air-force jets, the occasional Hercules transport plane, agricultural machinery or sometimes a blast from the quarry disturb the peace.
